c.t: III. Tribal Commission on Judicial Conduct; Organization
c.sp: library|us/nsn/srmt/council/acts|Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe Judicial Oversight Commission Ordinance (Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Act)|III

c.x: A Tribal Commission on Judicial Conduct is hereby established. The Commissi
The members of the Commission shall elect one of their members to serve as
One (1) person shall be appointed for a three (3) year term;
One (1) person shall be appointed for a two (2) year term; and
One (1) person shall be appointed for a one (1) year term.
The persons first appointed by the Tribal Council shall serve the following
A Commission Member may be removed for cause upon submission of a written c
Each member of the Commission shall be compensated at the normal rate estab
For any action taken three (3) members of the Commission shall constitute a

c.sp: library|us/nsn/srmt/council/acts|Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe Judicial Oversight Commission Ordinance (Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Act)|IV

c.x: Be at least 35 years of age;
Not be a member of the Tribal Court Staff;
Be of good moral character;
Possess a Bachelor's degree in a related field.
Demonstrate knowledge of Tribal law and Indian issues.
In addition to the requirements listed above, at least one (1) member of th

c.sp: library|us/nsn/srmt/council/acts|Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe Judicial Oversight Commission Ordinance (Saint Regis Mohawk Tribal Act)|V

c.x: To conduct hearings and investigations, administer oaths or affirmations, s
To request and receive from any court, department, division, board, bureau,
To report at least annually, and at such other times as the Commission shal
To adopt, promulgate, amend and rescind rules and procedures, not otherwise
To do all other things necessary and convenient to carry out its functions,

The Commission may, on its own motion, initiate an investigation of a judge

Subject to the approval of the Commission, the judge may agree on a stateme
If, after a formal written complaint has been served pursuant to this Ordin
After a hearing, the Commission may determine that a judge be admonished, c
The Tribal Council may suspend a judge or justice from exercising the power
A judge or justice who is suspended from office by the court shall receive
Nothing in this subdivision shall prevent the Commission from determining t
Suspension pending investigation
If during the course of or after an investigation or hearing, the Commissio
The Commission shall notify the complainant of its disposition of the compl
